result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Jessie J Howen was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

11:02 a.m.   Defendant Jessie J Howen appeared by video from an institution.   Attorney (Atty) Shunette Torna Campbell appeared by video. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.
Cases heard today are 13CF372, 14CF34 and 14CF287.

Court calls the case.
ADA Jambois states the appearances.

This hearing is a continuation as the Court wanted to speak with the defendant in re:  his withdrawal for his petition for conditional release.
Court questions the defendant with regards to withdrawing his petition for conditional release.
Defendant responds and does wish to withdraw his petition for conditional release and states the reason for his withdrawal on the record.
Court again questions the defendant if he is in agreement with withdrawing his petition for conditional release.
Atty Shunette Campbell makes further statements on the record with regards to the withdrawal of conditional release.
ADA Jambois takes no position on the statements of Atty Shunette Campbell.
Court makes statments to the parties with regards to the defendant refiling his petition for conditional release in the future.

BY THE COURT:
Court received verbal clarification from the defendant that he wishes to withdraw his petition for conditional release.
Hearing on March 24, 2021 at 11:00 am.

9:04 a.m.   Attorney (Atty) Shunette Torna Campbell appeared by video.  Defendant does not appear.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video.
Cases heard today are 13CF372, 14CF34 and 14CF287.

Court calls the case(s).  
ADA Jambois states the appearances.  

Court questions Atty Hunter in re:  client's request to withdraw his petition for conditional release.
Atty Hunter, if she is allowed, to excuse her client's attendance for today's hearing.
Atty Hunter states that there was a "lack of" setup for the defendant to be appearing via video from Mendota Mental Health.
ADA Jambois would request that this be adjourned and states his reasons on the record.
Court is in agreement with ADA Jambois.
ADA Jambois does not have anything else to put on the record.
Atty Hunter states she is in agreement with the waiver of time limits and makes additional statements.

BY THE COURT:
Cases to be adjourned 
Court puts on the record that any time limits that need to be waived for today; is for good cause.

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jessie J Howen in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:04 a.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
This is a petition requesting conditional release of the defendant.
Clerk attempts to reach the witness for the defense by phone without success 
10:10 a.m. court takes a short recess until the witness can be reached.
10:52 a.m. court is back in session.  Witness is on the phone and ready to testify.
Attorney Drengler makes a statement and requests a withdrawal of petition for conditional release.
Court questions the defendant.  Attorney and defendant both agree to not go forward.  Court excuses the witness from his phone testimony.  

Court accepts the motion to withdraw the petition for conditional release.
All reports filed pertaining to this conditional release are ordered sealed in the court record.
10:54 a.m. court is in recess.
Review hearing on June 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant is not present.  
1:35 p.m. case is called.  Court states the appearances on the record and questions the whereabouts of the defendant.
The attorney states he did not know whether the defendant could be present by video.
Court explains that the court does this type of hearing quite often if its arranged earlier.  
Court tries to call the facility to have the defendant appear by video.  The defendant appears by telephone.  
Court explains to the defendant as to the status of this matter by telephone.  Court explains that his appearance should be via video or by telephone or adjourn the matter.  
Attorney Drengler apologizes for not making arrangements and requests this matter to be adjourned so the defendant can be present.  
Court takes a short recess to allow the defendant to speak with counsel.
1:51 p.m. Court is in short recess. 
2:07 pm.  Court is back in session with the same appearances.  Attorney Drengler had the opportunity to discuss the matter with his client and was able to speak with his doctor.  The state indicates his doctor is not available until July 18th.  
Attorney Drengler defers to the court 

Court schedules for June 28, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.  
Court asks the prosecution to get back to the court as to availability of the doctor.  

2:13 p.m.  Matter is continued. 


  Review hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

3:22 p.m. Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 13CF372 ct 1 & 2, 14CF34 ct 1, 14CF287 Ct 1. Author of the report is present in Court today (Ms. Daringetski).

3:46 p.m. Atty Drengler makes final statements.

- Report - Ralph Baker M.D. dated Jan. 30, 2015 - Original filed in 13CF372
- Report - Ralph Baker M.D. dated Dec. 1, 2014  - Original filed in 13CF372
Sentencing hearing at 08-25-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CF287, 14CF426, 14CM165
11:06 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court questions Atty Drengler re: competency of client. 
Atty Drengler believes his client is still competent at this time. 

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Parties stipulate to the evaluation by Dr. Baker.  Proposes the Court enter those pleas as NGI and place the defendant on supervision.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF372 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI. 
14CF34 Count 1 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI.
14CF287 Count 1 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court does not enter the conviction as parties have stipulated to the reports of Dr. Baker.  Court reads the opinion of Dr. Baker
Both counsel agree to the stipulation. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court further finds the defendant Not Guilty by Reason of Mental disease or defect in 13CF372 Counts 1 & 2, 14CF34 Count 1 and 14CF287 Count 1.  

Court questions parties re: maximum penalties. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Believe the maximum penalties would be 30 years. 
Atty Drengler makes statements.  Asks court to amend the Order he had prepared. 
Court amends the maximums on the Order. 
Atty Knaapen suggests an 8 year period of commitment in 13CF372 and 6 years on each of the bail jumpings (14CF34 & 14CF287) to run concurrent. 
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court.  The victim is present and would like to address the court prior.  Makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Victim makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the victim. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions sentence credit. 
Atty Drengler indicates there are 7 days credit total. 
Court will not put the credit on the order yet but will add the credit later to ensure there is the correct amount. 
Court questions if parties agree to the orders running concurrently.
Parties agree to concurrent orders. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court enters an Order that the defendant be committed to DHS in 13CF372 for a period of 8 years and in 14CF34 & 14CF287 for 6 years, running concurrent.
The days of credit will be added after they are determined. 
Court orders a Pre-Disposition Investigation.  
The Court orders DHS to conduct the PDI and prepare a report to assist the court in framing a placement order under the commitment.  
All the defendant's treatment records requested by the investigator be released to the investigator.  
Report to be furnished no later than 8/11/2015.
All other counts and files are dismissed and read-in pursuant to the plea agreement. 

Atty Drengler to prepare the further orders needed at the final hearing.
Plea hearing at 06-09-2015 10:30 am
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jessie J Howen appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews the files. 
Court questions defendant.
